etomica.space

Class Space

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.space.Space
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISpace, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Space1D, Space2D, Space3D

    public abstract class Space
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, ISpace
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      abstract int D()
      The dimension of this space.
      static Space getInstance(int D)
      Returns a space instance of the given dimension, which must be 1, 2, or 3.

      Returns an array of dimension D, with each element equal to the given value.
      abstract int[] makeArrayD(int i)
      Returns an array of dimension D, with each element equal to the given value.
      abstract IOrientation makeOrientation()
      Constructs and returns a new Orientation appropriate to the space.

      Constructs and returns a new RotationTensor appropriate to the space.
      abstract Tensor makeTensor()
      Constructs and returns a new Tensor appropriate to the space.
      abstract IVectorMutable makeVector()
      Constructs and returns a new Vector appropriate to the space.
      IVectorMutable makeVector(double[] a)
      Returns a Vector initialized to the given set of values in the array.
      static IVectorMutable makeVector(int D)
      Returns a Vector from the space of the given dimension.
      IVectorMutable makeVector(int[] k)
      Returns a Vector initialized to the given set of values in the array (cast to double).
      IVectorMutable[] makeVectorArray(int n)
      Instance methods that makes and returns an array of vectors having the given number of elements.
      abstract double powerD(double a)
      Returns the given value raised to the Dth power, where D is the dimension of the space.
      abstract int powerD(int a)
      Returns the given value raised to the Dth power, where D is the dimension of the space.
      abstract double rootD(double a)
      Returns the given value raised to the power 1/D, where D is the dimension of the space.
      abstract double sphereArea(double r)
      Returns the surface "area" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space.
      abstract double sphereVolume(double r)
      Returns the "volume" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space.

      • sphereVolume

        public abstract double sphereVolume(double r)
        Description copied from interface: ISpace
        Returns the "volume" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space. In 1-D, this is twice the radius; in 2-D the area of the circle; in 3-D the volume of the sphere.
        Specified by:
        sphereVolume in interface ISpace
        Parameters:
        r - the radius
        Returns:
        the volume

      • sphereArea

        public abstract double sphereArea(double r)
        Description copied from interface: ISpace
        Returns the surface "area" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space. In 1-D this is zero; in 2-D the circumference of the circle; in 3-D the surface area of the sphere.
        Specified by:
        sphereArea in interface ISpace
        Parameters:
        r - the radius
        Returns:
        the area

      • makeVector

        public static IVectorMutable makeVector(int D)
        Returns a Vector from the space of the given dimension.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if D is not 1, 2, or 3.

      • makeVector

        public IVectorMutable makeVector(double[] a)
        Returns a Vector initialized to the given set of values in the array. Spatial dimension of the Vector is determined by the length of a.
        Specified by:
        makeVector in interface ISpace
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a.length is not 1, 2, or 3.

      • makeVector

        public IVectorMutable makeVector(int[] k)
        Returns a Vector initialized to the given set of values in the array (cast to double). Spatial dimension of the Vector is determined by the length of a.
        Specified by:
        makeVector in interface ISpace
